helpDocs.title: Operation Manual
helpDocs.subtitle: Use this guide to complete your workflow from data import to evaluation.
helpDocs.quickStart1: Open Setup Wizard and configure storage paths for documents and database.
helpDocs.quickStart2: Go to Settings > Models and configure your cloud API key or local Ollama model.
helpDocs.quickStart3: Add mount points in File Resources, then upload and process your source files.
helpDocs.quickStart4: Review knowledge points and tags, then generate annotation pairs in Training Lab.
helpDocs.quickStart5: Save data for fine-tuning, submit jobs in Production Tuning, and compare outputs in Evaluation.
helpDocs.setupDetail1: Use dedicated storage folders instead of system directories and verify the saved paths in Settings.
helpDocs.setupDetail2: For cloud models, save API keys first and then choose provider/model; for local models, confirm Ollama is running before generation.
helpDocs.setupDetail3: Before ingesting files, verify mount point readability, supported file types, and stable source naming for traceability.
helpDocs.setupDetail4: Start with a small single-document trial run, then scale to batch processing after the workflow is validated.
helpDocs.workspaceFileResources: File Resources: manage mount points, document lists, notes, and document previews.
helpDocs.workspaceKnowledgeBase: Knowledge Base: browse and edit knowledge points, keywords, weights, and tags.
helpDocs.workspaceDataCenter: Data Center: upload documents, trigger processing, and inspect generated knowledge points.
helpDocs.workspaceTrainingLab: Training Lab: filter knowledge points, generate instruction-response pairs, and edit results.
helpDocs.workspaceProduction: Production Tuning: submit fine-tuning jobs, monitor status, and inspect logs.
helpDocs.workspaceEvaluation: Evaluation: run prompts before/after fine-tuning and compare result quality.
helpDocs.workspaceChat: Chat: perform retrieval-assisted QA and validate your current knowledge base behavior.
helpDocs.operationDocument: Document preparation: add source folders or files and ensure each document is processed successfully.
helpDocs.operationKnowledge: Knowledge curation: remove low-quality knowledge points and tune weights or keywords.
helpDocs.operationAnnotation: Data annotation: generate candidates, review instruction-response quality, and save valid samples.
helpDocs.operationFinetuning: Model tuning: select untuned data, estimate cost, submit jobs, and track progress.
helpDocs.operationEvaluation: Result evaluation: use shared prompts to compare baseline and tuned outputs, then iterate.
helpDocs.acceptance1: Document phase: each file reaches processed state and produces stable knowledge points.
helpDocs.acceptance2: Knowledge phase: core points are retained, noisy points are removed, and keywords cover key terminology.
helpDocs.acceptance3: Annotation phase: instruction and response are semantically aligned, non-empty, and grounded in selected points.
helpDocs.acceptance4: Fine-tuning phase: jobs are trackable, logs are readable, and failed jobs have clear root causes.
helpDocs.acceptance5: Evaluation phase: with identical prompts, tuned output improves in structure, accuracy, or relevance.
helpDocs.retry1: If processing fails, validate file format and content integrity, then retry with one document first.
helpDocs.retry2: If generation fails, lower filters, shorten prompts, and verify active model configuration.
helpDocs.retry3: If fine-tuning fails, inspect provider error codes in job logs and resubmit with adjusted parameters.
helpDocs.retry4: If evaluation is unstable, keep templates and variables fixed and compare across multiple runs before changing datasets.
helpDocs.shortcutOpenHelp: Open Help menu with Alt+H, then select Documentation or About.
helpDocs.shortcutMenu: Open top menus with Alt + menu letter (F/K/T/P/V/L/S/H).
helpDocs.shortcutEscape: Press Escape to close the currently opened dropdown menu.
helpDocs.shortcutLanguage: Use the top-right language button to switch between English and Chinese UI.
helpDocs.troubleshootBackend: Backend unavailable: check tray controls and restart backend service.
helpDocs.troubleshootModel: Model call fails: verify API key, endpoint, selected model, and network connectivity.
helpDocs.troubleshootGenerate: No annotations generated: lower filters and verify knowledge points are available.
helpDocs.troubleshootJob: Job not progressing: open job details and logs to inspect provider-side errors.
helpDocs.dataSafety1: Use mount points scoped to dedicated project folders whenever possible.
helpDocs.dataSafety2: Store cloud API keys only through Settings so encrypted storage is applied.
helpDocs.dataSafety3: Review audit and desensitization logs regularly in Privacy Center.
